column4: does ubuntu have a way to load balance multiple internet connections, 1 wired, 1 usb, 1 wireless?
only some test cases to bandwidth limit a connection.   Its not what you would call...friendly.   Not at first glance
you have 3 connections to the internet?
im wanting to use my cellphone inet, dsl, and a nearby wifi on a server for incoming and only use the dsl for outgoing
yeah i want to make the ubuntu a router itself
jill, yea i have 300 its working fine...
so if a packet comes in on cellphone, you want the reply to go out on DSL?

the routing is so complicated... so if i get a ip of 75.1.75.1 from isp for DSL modem... my router is assigned 10.0.0.1, using DMZ it gives my Ubuntu-server the public ip of 75.1.75.1, and my isp assignes me a block of ips  76.199.50.102-109 or whatever, can i make the ubuntu virtually manage all of those ip's? or just one?
you could use aliases an have ubuntu respond to all of those addresses.
how would you set up an alias for them?
ifconfig eth0:1 XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX     ifconfig eth0:2 XXX.XXX.XXX.YYY
